Directories¶

directories.py is a file containing the function get_dir which allows the user to quickly call a directory within the project folder, also for convenience the packages os and sys are imported when directories.py is imported with the * specifier. Finally the dictionary DIRS contains common directories so as to avoid multiple calls to get_dir. Finally since the entries in DIRS are outputs of get_dir the inherent directory checking is also present. Thus an invalid directory will raise errors

directories.get_dir(folder_name=None)[source]¶

get_dir returns the top-level directory of the package as an absolute path if folder_name is not specified [1]. If an exiting sub directory is specified as str into the field folder_name then the return of get_dir will be absolute path to this sub directory [2]. Usage with file names inside a directory is also possible, see example below [3]

Parameters:folder_name (basestring) – The name of a folder, file, or relative path
Returns:The absolute path to the root directory or, if specified, to a sub directory within the root
Return type:unicode

[1] Obtaining Root Directory:

>>> get_dir() # This will return the absolute path to root directory
C:/Python27/KBE

[2] Obtaining a Sub-Directory:

>>> get_dir('icons') # This will return the absolute path to the subdirectory /icons
C:/Python27/KBE\icons

[3] Obtaining File-Directory:

>>> get_dir('user/userinput.xlsx') # This will return the absolute path to the file userinput.xlsx
C:/Python27/KBE\user\userinput.xlsx
